column4: Anyone know how I'd put yaboot back my iMac? I was installing OS 9 to test Mac on Linux and it overwrote it ><
Install to the MBR with ybin -v -v
how would I go about that? I'm booted into Ubuntu (kinda?) through the CD because I can't boot into Linux because it boots into OS X because yaboot got overridden

how would I go about that ((12:17:08) eim: SirG3: Install to the MBR with ybin -v -v)? I'm booted into a shell through the CD because I can't boot into Linux because it boots into OS X because yaboot got overridden :-(
You need to use the Ubuntu PPC CD to rescue boot to your linux partition.
Once turned on your Mac hold 'C' for CD-ROM boot.
I am booted off of the Ubuntu CD...... and sjoerd: it doesn't show up :-/ just the button to boot off of OS X.......
Rescue boot your linux system and reinstall yaboot (MBR) via ybin.
erm, excuse my ignorance, rescue boot?
Use the Ubuntu PPC install CD as boot resource to rescue your previous Linux installation. chroot to / and execute ybin.
ok, how would I mount the Ubuntu partition? I tried mount /dev/hda11 /mnt/ubuntu (after creating /mnt and /mnt/ubuntu)?
Should work if /dev/hda11 is your root partition.
it is, but  ls /dev/ doesn't show any hda.......
That's strange. try dmes |grep hd and check if you've the kernel supports your hdd.
| KobrAs: I booted off the CD, hit esc and got into a shell, that the proper way eh?
*sigh* I have no clue why I can't mount that partition!
